text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with black-eyed peas on rice we're
going to put the greens right in there
with the pork this is a New Year's Day
classic traditional southern specialty
if you eat for our New Year's Day they
say you have great prosperity the rest
of the year and the black-eyed peas are
included because they say they look like
coins which is really funny since they
look absolutely nothing like coins so
I'm not sure what kind of legume based
you know economy they're talking about
but they don't look like coins to me
look like black-eyed peas and the Greens
represent cash so here we go we're going
to take one pound of black eyed peas dry
we're going to soak those overnight and
they're going to swell up and soften
they're beautiful in a heavy Dutch oven
I'm going to cook some bacon and a pound
of neck bones all right sometimes they
use ham hock sometimes they use pig's
feet so we're going to cook that on a
medium heat for about five minutes until
some of that fat starts coming out that
bacon we're going to put in a cup each
celery carrots onions and I like a lot
of veggies in this if it wasn't for the
bacon in the pork necks this would
pretty much be vegetarian and we're just
going to saute that in that bacon fat
for about six seven minutes just till it
softens a little bit I'm going to add
some nice chopped garlic give that about
a minute in there and then we're going
to add some liquid here so we're going
to add six cups of cold water and to
that we're going to add our pound of
drained overnight soaked beans and we're
going to put that on a high heat bring
that up to a simmer I'm going to throw
in a bay leaf a little bit of cumin some
dry thyme some cayenne of course some
black pepper but no salt I've heard a
lot of theories on salt and beans if you
cook it with salt from beginning it
doesn't have as good a texture as if you
put it in after so we're going to do
here is we're going to simmer this for
45 minutes covered so you want to turn
the heat down to low alright so you
bring it up to a simmer cover it 45
minutes we're going to take off the
cover and we're going to add some stuff
alright we're going to add one can of
those diced tomatoes that have the green
chilies in it I'm going to put in a
teaspoon of salt that's my preference
okay if you want to adjust that of
course and then we're going to simmer
that uncovered until it's done which is
going to be about another 40 minutes or
so in the meantime we're gonna take one
big bunch of greens I'm using kale you
can use Swiss chard mustard greens
collard greens etc I'm going to pull out
those ribs alright I'm going to tear it
up in little pieces and just give it a
good rinse now when you take it out to
put it in your black-eyed pea kettle
lift it out so you don't get sand in it
so this ants at the bottom so don't if
you just dump the water out the sand is
going to stick to the greens I'm going
to dice some smoked ham so about 45
minutes later that's what we got it's
getting thicker it's kind of got it like
a gravy consistency the the beans aren't
falling apart but they're tender almost
I'm going to take out my neck bones and
of course the meat is going to fall off
the neck bones there's not much meat on
it but what there is oh it's good neck
so you want to get that neck meat back
in there we're going to throw in our
diced ham give it a stir we're going to
throw in our greens remember lift it out
of the water
don't try to drain the water out you'll
never get all that sand out of there
we're going to put in our greens we're
going to push them down with a spoon
into that hot mixture and it's going to
wilt now here's where you got to decide
how long to cook it based on your greens
kale Swiss chard they cook pretty fast
you know I only cook this about ten
minutes and they were you know was
tender enough for me
some of the other greens they're more
bitter they're thicker you got to cook
them longer okay so you're going to have
to adjust that yourself and there we go
10-15 minutes later I had incredible
black-eyed peas with greens three kinds
of pork and by the way I crunched the
numbers on a spreadsheet three kinds of
pork three times the prosperity but who
knows I've been wrong before I said I've
been wrong before
thank you come on pay attention all
right and that's it put it on some rice
eat that on New Year's Day you won't
believe the wealth and prosperity that
comes you this year you're going to say
hey chef John was right what a great
year install because of the black-eyed
peas remember you got to start today
before you go soak your beans but give
it a try go to the site all the
ingredients are there and as always
happy new year and enjoy
